results.title: The Infinite Variety
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Life on Earth”.
David Attenborough examines the beginnings of life on earth. It took nearly 3,000 million years for life to evolve from the first primitive cells to a single creature such as a jellyfish, and these stages of evolution are traced.

results.title: The First forests
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Life on Earth”.
Part 3 of a series which traces the dramatic history of life on earth from its beginnings about 3,500 million years ago to the final emergence of man. In this episode David Attenborough discusses the evolution of plants from the first algae and moss-like plants that crept onto the land from the waters edge to the giant trees of todays forests, showing how they solved the two major problems of support and reproduction in the absence of water. The arrival of plants on land made it possible for animal life to live there as well and the evolution of the first plants and animals is inextricably linked. Also examines how plants grew taller, seeking light and how insects developed wings to reach their food sources. Microphotography is used to reveal unsuspected details of mosses, liverworts, ferns, cycads and conifers.

results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Life on Earth”
The history of the insects and their amazing interdependence and co-evolution with the plants that support them.

results.title: Life in the trees
results.creator_credit: Richard Attenborough, John Sparks, Reiner Moritz Productions, Warner Bros Pictures and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “Life on Earth”.
David Attenborough examines the evolution of the primates. As well as looking at the better known members of the ape family - monkeys, gorillas and chimpanzees - it also looks at some of the lesser known cousins. This episode contains the memorable scene where David Attenborough meets a group of young mountain gorillas in Zaire.

results.title: Wagga Wagga
results.creator_credit: Rhonda Small, Eric Thompson and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Life in Australia”
Shows family life and the rural, industrial and commercial interests of the city of Wagga Wagga, NSW. Also covers sporting, cultural and recreational activities.

results.title: Sydney
results.creator_credit: Joe Scully, Eric Thompson and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Life in Australia”.
Presents many and varied aspects of life in Sydney including business and industrial activities, shops and supermarkets, play centres, schools and universities, hospitals and the rapid growth of new buildings. Shows the various recreational choices including football, cricket, surfing, yachting, fishing or just strolling in the beautiful parks and gardens and evening entertainment in the famous Kings Cross with its multitude of night clubs, restaurants and discotheques.

results.title: Perth
results.creator_credit: Henry Lewes, Eric Thompson and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Life in Australia”.
A pictorial story with minimum commentary on the city of Perth. The daily newspaper is used as the medium to reflect, social, business and sporting activities of the average Australian family living in the city of Perth.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Henry Lewes, Eric Thompson and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: Launceston
results.creator_credit: John Edwards, Peter Young, Eric Thompson and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Life in Australia”.
Aspects of life in Launceston. Industries include Paton and Baldwins woollen mills, Repco ball bearing factory, timber mills and furniture manufacturers. Shows schools, the general hospital, churches, and the historic home of Entally built in 1820. Motor racing at Longford, bicycyle racing, water skiing and archery are popular forms of recreation. Theatres, restaurants and night clubs, provide a variety of evening entertainment.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Edwards, Peter Young, Eric Thompson and Australian National Film Board
